wikipedia_page.main: Paddy Feeny (25 April 1931 – 10 June 2018) was a British broadcaster. He was a presenter of the BBC World Service's Saturday Special (later renamed Sportsworld) programme from 1959 to 1995.

response: Paddy Feeny presented the programme from the start in 1959 through to his retirement in 1995. Other presenters have included Martin Fookes, Mike Costello and Russell Fuller. The current presenters are Lee James (BBC) for Saturday and Sarah Mulkerrins for Sunday. The current producers are Joanne Smith and Ross Mitchell. The programme editor is Matt Davies.
The presenter was Paddy Feeny, followed John Tidmarsh.
|'A genius on air' – tribute to Saturday Special legend Paddy Feeny (1931–2018) BBC, June 11, 2018
